OSU Online CS Tools
Week 2: Overview

Week 2: Overview

Introduction

In this week, we will dig into the pieces of a program, with a particular focus on computation. After all, programs run on these expensive things called “computers.”

First, we’ll look at how to express computations as a sequence of operations on data. Then, you’ll try your hand at writing some programs to do some computations and get your first experience with converting simple science formulas into computer code.

By the end of this week, you should be well on your way toward translating a problem statement into an appropriate coding solution that involves arithmetic (CLO1).

Module Learning Outcomes

After successful completion of this module, you should be able to do the following (in addition to answering the questions listed below): target

  1. Write expressions and statements
    • Is each line of a program called an expression or a statement?
    • What is the relationship between an expression and a value?
  2. Identify and use operators and variables
    • Can you give an example of an operator?
    • Can you give an example of an expression that involves an operator?
    • What is the purpose of a variable?
    • Can you give an example of an expression that involves a variable?
  3. Convert among integers, floats and strings
    • What are the different kinds of data that a program can have?
    • What happens if you treat a value as the wrong type of data?
    • What is an example of treating a value as the wrong type of data?
  4. Explain what a sequence of statements does
    • Can you explain the difference between the print() and input() functions?
    • When you’re given two statements that assign and then use a variable, can you describe what is happening?

Explorations

Use the pages within this module to explore the following concepts:

  • Expressions
  • Statements
  • Operators
  • Variables
  • Conversions

Task List

Complete the following assignments and other tasks:

  • Assignment #2, which requires combining different program structures
